ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 2hrs for taking the course and 2.5hrs for homework

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: This course is excellent if you want to study statistical genetics.

strengths: covered a lot of interesting material, gained experience with a few important algorithms weakness: spent the majority of our time getting a narrow view of specific paper results suggestion: more real-world applications or a final project, such as a draft manuscript

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Hongyu Zhao  Dr. Zhao was very knowledgable and thoughtful in his presentations and answers. However, it might be nice to spark more discussion in class and provide more opportunities for research.
Instructor: Hongyu Zhao  Prof. Zhao is extremely helpful.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I will recommend this course to students who are interested in statistical genetics.
this was an interesting class, but with some more interactive content it could be one of the best classes in the department, as this is a topic that a lot of students care about.
